data.event: For millennia, the land now known as Kansas was inhabited by Native Americans.

event.title: 1803, most of modern Kansas was secured

data.event: In 1803, most of modern Kansas was secured by the United States as part of the Louisiana Purchase.
In 1854, the Kansas Territory was organized, then in 1861 Kansas became the 34th U.S. state.
In 1854, the Kansas Territory was organized, then in 1861 Kansas became the 34th U.S. state.

event.title: 1878, Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway and parties from Marion County and McPherson County chartered

data.event: In 1878, Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway and parties from Marion County and McPherson County chartered the Marion and McPherson Railway Company.
In 1879, a branch line was built from Florence to McPherson, in 1880 it was extended to Lyons, in 1881 it was extended to Ellinwood.
In 1879, a branch line was built from Florence to McPherson, in 1880 it was extended to Lyons, in 1881 it was extended to Ellinwood.
In 1879, a branch line was built from Florence to McPherson, in 1880 it was extended to Lyons, in 1881 it was extended to Ellinwood.
The line from Florence to Marion, was abandoned in 1968.

event.title: 1992, the line from Marion to McPherson was sold

data.event: In 1992, the line from Marion to McPherson was sold to Central Kansas Railway.

event.title: 1993, after heavy flood damage, the line from Marion to McPherson was abandoned

data.event: In 1993, after heavy flood damage, the line from Marion to McPherson was abandoned.
